result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew F. Whitmore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: with huber for work, medical care and treatment.  No objection to EMP.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew F. Whitmore

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Britney 
Case Called: 3:11 p.m. 
State appears by ADA Desiree Toldt. Defendant appears in person with Attorney Austin Mort.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief filed. 
State recites recommendation. 
PLEA: Ct.1- Disorderly Conduct>>NO CONTEST 
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made: a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: 30 days MCJ with huber for work, medical care and treatment, no objection to EMP. COURT remits all CC. Defendant is entitled to 6 days credit.
Adj: 3:18 p.m.

Clerk: Britney
Case Called: 3:03 p.m. 
State appears by ADA Desiree Toldt. Defendant appears in person with Attorney Austin Mort. Date & time set for Final Pre-trial. Attorney Mort states defendant wishes to plea today. 
Defendant to complete paperwork and Plea Hearing can be done. 
Adj: 3:04 p.m.

Jury Trial on July 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on June 11, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Request For Adjournment of Jury Trial on 5/6/15 - granted

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 9:49 am 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner for Desiree Toldt; Deft appears in person with Atty Austin Mort.
No agreement at this time - parties continue to work toward resolution. 
1 day jury trial with 30 jurors to be called in. 
COURT advises parties to file JI and MIL 1 week before trial. 
Adj: 9:50 am

Jury Trial on May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on April 22, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 25, 2015 at 03:05 pm.
